title: Typecheck panics feat. a closure and a struct with a private field and a public method

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
### Code ```Rust mod m { pub struct S { foo: i32 } impl S { pub fn foo(&self) -> i32 { 42 } } } fn bar(s: &m::S) { || s.foo() + s.foo; } fn main() {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0 (09c42c458 2021-10-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: 09c42c45858d5f3aedfa670698275303a3d19afa commit-date: 2021-10-18 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` Also checked beta and nightly at [https://play.rust-lang.org](https://play.rust-lang.org): ``` rustc 1.57.0-beta.2 (7e4c9eebd 2021-10-22) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu rustc 1.58.0-nightly (ff0e14829 2021-10-31) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu ``` ### Error output ``` error[E0616]: field `foo` of struct `S` is private --> bug.rs:9:18 | 9 | || s.foo() + s.foo; | ^^^ private field | help: a method `foo` also exists, call it with parentheses | 9 | || s.foo() + s.foo(); | ++ error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_typeck/src/check/upvar.rs:641:30: ProjectionKinds Deref and Field were mismatched: (Field(0, 0), Deref) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1147:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.0 (09c42c458 2021-10-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `bar` #1 [typeck] type-checking `bar::{closure#0}` end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0616`. ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1147:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: std::panic::panic_any 2: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::bug 3: rustc_errors::Handler::bug 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 7: alloc::slice::::sort_by::{{closure}} 8: alloc::slice::merge_sort 9: rustc_typeck::check::upvar::::compute_min_captures 10: rustc_typeck::check::upvar::::analyze_closure 11: ::visit_expr 12: rustc_hir::intravisit::walk_expr 13: ::visit_expr 14: rustc_typeck::check::upvar::::closure_analyze 15: rustc_infer::infer::InferCtxtBuilder::enter 16: rustc_typeck::check::typeck 17: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 18: ::typeck 19: rustc_typeck::check::typeck 20: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 21: ::typeck 22: rustc_middle::ty::::par_body_owners 23: rustc_typeck::check::typeck_item_bodies 24: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 25: ::typeck_item_bodies 26: rustc_session::utils::::time 27: rustc_typeck::check_crate 28: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 29: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 30: ::analysis 31: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 32: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 33: rustc_span::with_source_map 34: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```
